communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former State Department diplomat Alexandra Uteev "Alix" Johnson (August 9, 1946 – October 12, 2002). Her death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find her obituary at the following link: https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/128883126/alexandra_uteev-johnson

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: City of Roanoke Rescue of Black-and-White Tuxedo Cat (Valiente)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

February 21, 2026

 FOIA Officer for the City of Roanoke, Virginia
robin.viohl@roanokeva.gov

Re: FOIA Request – October 27, 2024 Rescue of Black-and-White Tuxedo Cat (Valiente)

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I request records related to the rescue, handling, and custody of a black-and-white tuxedo cat named Valiente at Towers Shopping Center, Roanoke, Virginia, on October 27, 2024. This request includes records in the custody of both the Roanoke Police Department (including Animal Control) and Roanoke Fire-EMS.
Please provide all records, electronic or paper, in the following categories:

1. Personnel Information
Names, badge numbers, and assignments of any Police officers present at the scene.
Any Animal Control officers notified, dispatched, or involved.
Names and assignments of Fire-EMS personnel, including Battalion Chief Robert Perdue and the responding firehouses.

2. Incident and Dispatch Records
CAD reports, dispatch logs, event summaries, and call detail records related to the incident.
Incident reports, after-action reports, or any internal reports generated by Police or Fire-EMS in connection with this event.

3. Body-Worn Camera / Audio / Video
All Police body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and radio communications/audio logs related to the rescue.
Any Fire-EMS audio, video, or operational recordings capturing the rescue or related communications.

4. Animal Handling / Custody Records
Intake logs, custody forms, or reports for Valiente on or about October 27, 2024.
Records showing which personnel or units had custody or transported the cat after the rescue.
Any documentation showing transfer to RCACP, veterinary providers, or other entities, including timing and personnel involved.
Records reflecting release, adoption, euthanasia, or continued custody of the cat.

5. Communications
Emails, memoranda, or written communications referencing Valiente.
Communications between Police, Fire-EMS, RCACP, or veterinary providers regarding the rescue, custody, or evaluation of the cat.

6. Metadata / Additional Notes
If records exist electronically, please provide metadata showing creation, modification, or access, to the extent easily available.
Please first confirm which records exist and provide an estimate of any fees before producing records, so that I may consider narrowing the request if necessary.
If separate fees apply for Police or Fire-EMS records, please notify me prior to processing.
If portions of records are exempt from disclosure, please identify the statutory exemption and provide all reasonably segregable portions.

Please note that during the incident, I may have used a different phone number than my current one; records associated with that number are responsive to this request.

Thank you for your assistance in fulfilling this request.

Respectfully, 

/s/ Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr.

Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr., pro se
1328 Peachtree Street NE
Atlanta, Georgia 30309-3209
(404) 389-5642
csdelozier@pm.me

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC Narcan Administration Records 2026
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. An IHSC Record reflecting the total number of Narcan administrations at ICE detention centers during Fiscal Year 2023 and 2024, including a breakdown of the location and date (by month/year) if each administration, if it exists. 
2. An IHSC Record reflecting the total number of positive drug tests for ICE detainees by facility during Fiscal Year 23 & 24. 

An adequate search responsive to this request will include, at minimum, a tasking of the ICE Health Services Corps.

I respectfully request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and attest and declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements in support of this request are true and accurate to the best of my knowledge and understanding. 

1. I am a member of the media engaged in information dissemination. See, e.g., https://theintercept.com/staff/r-andrew-free/; https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/; https://atlpresscollective.com/author/free/; https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/06/2024-07-01-ICE-Detainee-Deaths.pdf. 
2. As part of my reporting on immigration detention, I have received records from multiple jurisdictions across the country reflecting overdoses requiring emergency medical attention in ICE detention centers. These records indicate a prevalence of illegal drug use and unauthorized use of prescribed medications within facilities operated by certain ICE contractors that fit certain characteristics. 
3. ICE and at least one contractor are aware of, but have failed to disclose to the public, the death of at least one migrant in an ICE detention center related to fentanyl/synthetic fentanyl equivalent overdose. 
4. Public records I have obtained from ICE and local jurisdictions appear to reflect a rise in the number of overdoses inside certain ICE detention centers over the course of the past several months. 
5. As reflected by the widespread use of illegal drugs that preceded an immigrant's death from fentanyl-laced substances inside an ICE detention center, uncontrolled proliferation of illegal drugs within ICE detention poses deadly risks to the lives and safety of people inside. 
6. I will make these records available to the public and publish at least one edited piece about them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Non-Law Enforcement ALPR Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to usage of vehicle-based Automated License Plate Recognition (ALPR) technology in the City of San Francisco. This EXCLUDES all ALPR technology belonging to the San Francisco Police Department, and instead focuses on non-law enforcement ALPR systems and technology. For City of San Francisco / SFMTA ALPR technology, we are requesting:

1) NDAs, MSAs, SOWs, and contracts relating to the purchase and maintenance of ALPR systems owned/operated by the City of San Francisco / SFMTA
2) ALPR policies, procedures, guides, and training materials 
3)  The names of agencies and organizations with which the City of San Francisco / SFMTA shared ALPR data in 2025
4) All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods June 1st, 2024 until the date of processing this request (An audit log of ALPR queries, time/date, identity/role, agency, and type of data accessed will suffice). If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
5) Any MOU or data sharing agreement which allows San Francisco City / SFMTA ALPR records to be shared or queried by non-administrative city staff (e.g. federal agencies, SFPD, etc.).
6) Any search warrants, subpoenas, or court orders you have received for ALPR data in 2025. 

Previously, I submitted a FOIA to BAAQMD based on finding ALPR cameras on a vehicle with their logo on it. They referred me to the City of San Francisco, stating that you own the vehicle. The City of San Francisco stated that SFMTA had responsive documents. For more context, you may read my exchange with them and view a photo of the vehicle in question here: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/california-52/baaqmd-alpr-review-189686/

I appreciate your assistance. I'd be happy to chat and provide additional context to aid you in your search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

title: FOIA Request for Information Concerning Houston and Flock Safety (Houston Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information pertaining to the Houston and the Houston Police Department's (HPD) relationship with the company Flock Safety and the use of Flock cameras by Houston and HPD.

Flock Audit Logs:
- Organization Audit logs, including all searches conducted by HPD personnel.
The report should include data logged from the period of February 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

- Network Audit logs, including searches of HPD’s Flock network by any external agency.
The report should include data logged from the period of February 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

- Search Audit logs, including: User conducting the search, date, and time of search.
- Search reason or justification for each search conducted.

Data Sharing Between HPD and Other Agencies:
- Records reflecting Flock data sharing between HPD and other police departments (PDs), cities, agencies, and organizations.
- Records reflecting any Flock data sharing between HPD and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) or other federal agencies.
- Records reflecting any Flock data sharing between Alvin Independent School District (Alvin ISD) and ICE, to the extent such records are maintained by HPD.
- Records indicating whether HPD has shared Flock data or related information with ICE or other federal agencies.
- Identification of all external organizations with access to HPD’s Flock system data.

Federal and Interagency Searches:
- Records of any requests from federal agencies, other police departments, or external agencies to search a license plate number or for a particular person using information from Flock.
- Records of searches conducted by external agencies within HPD’s Flock network.

Hotlist Data:
- The number of vehicle searches performed by HPD and any participating departments based on hotlist hits.
- The number of hotlist hits.
- The hotlist hit rate.

The number of times Flock’s hotlist generated a hit based on:
- A citation for driving without a license, or
- An ICE administrative warrant.

Policies and Guidelines:
- Internal HPD policy guidelines concerning Flock data sharing.

Internal HPD policies regarding data sharing with:
- Other police departments
- Government agencies
- School districts
- Private businesses
- Homeowners associations (HOAs)
- Any other external organizations

The report(s) and records should include data logged from February 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bad Bunny Super Bowl FCC Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To the FOIA Officer:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the FCC's implementing regulations, 47 C.F.R. § 0.461.

I request that the Federal Communications Commission provide me with copies of the following records:

All formal and informal complaints submitted to the FCC regarding the Super Bowl LIX halftime show performance by the artist Bad Bunny (Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio), which was broadcast on February 8, 2026.

All correspondence, including letters and emails, from members of the U.S. Congress, their staffs, or other government officials concerning this specific performance.

Any records, including but not limited to docket filings or public comments, filed in response to or citing the investigations requested by Congressman Randy Fine (as referenced in public reports from February 2026) or other officials .

The timeframe for this request is February 8, 2026, through the date of this request's processing.

I am willing to pay reasonable duplication fees for this request up to $25 Please notify me before exceeding this amount. As a requester seeking information that is likely in the public interest, I ask that you waive any fees associated with this request, as the disclosure of the requested information is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of FCC enforcement and broadcast decency standards.

If you deny all or any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you believe justifies the withholding of information and notify me of your appeal procedures.

If you have any questions regarding this request, or if you require any additional information to facilitate processing, please contact me at the phone number or email address listed above.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Carlos

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2026 to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2026 to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Please provide the audit data in a structured format such as .csv, .xls, or another machine-readable database filetype.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Zeke Martin

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All resisting and obstructing (R&O) incident reports and related materials involving officer Zachary Bennett.

For each R&O‑related incident involving the above officers, please provide:
All incidents reports including
Officer narratives 
Officer names
Date, time, and location
All charges
All related documents
Any internal summaries or case notes associated with the incident
Body-worn camera footage
All body‑worn camera footage recorded by the listed officers
All body‑worn camera footage recorded by any other officer present
Any audio recordings associated with the incident
Dispatch Records
911 call audio (if applicable)
Dispatch notes or timestamps

The time frame for all requests is January 1, 2023 to December 31, 2025.

I am requesting these records in my capacity as a journalist investigating matters of significant public interest regarding Resisting and Obstructing charges in Kalamazoo County. The requested documents will contribute to public understanding of the charge and the way they are issued.
For records originating or only existing in digital form, I respectfully request these records be provided in their native electronic formats that preserve all metadata. Specifically:
Body‑cam and footage: original video files
Emails: .eml or .msg
Documents: .docx, .xlsx, .pdf (searchable)

Please deliver these electronic records to the email address listed below. If file size limitations prevent email delivery, I am willing to accept records via a secure file transfer method of your choosing or provide a storage device, if necessary.

If the documents I have requested are not disclosable in their entirety, I request that you release all nonexempt portions of the documents after separating them from the portions you deem exempt. With respect to documents or portions of documents that are exempt, please state with particularity the specific legal and factual basis justifying each exemption, as well as the nature of information being withheld. See MCL 15.235(5)(a)-(c); MCL 15.244. This includes identifying those records that are being withheld in their entirety. See Herald Co, Inc v Ann Arbor Public Schools, 224 Mich App 266, 275 (1997).

If no responsive documents exist for a particular portion of this request, please clearly identify which portions of this request have been denied for that reason, rather than providing a general statement of non-existence.
If you determine that any portion of my request is exempt because it contains information you deem privileged or deliberative, please identify the specific privileged information with particularity and provide the factual basis for the deliberative process claim.

Pursuant to MCL 15.234(2), I request a waiver or reduction of fees as this request is made by a representative of the news media and the requested information is in the public interest because it contributes significantly to the public's understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. If you do not grant this fee waiver, please contact me before processing if the total cost will exceed $500.00.

Please note that willful failure to comply with a FOIA request is grounds for civil fines, and legal fees and costs may be awarded to a plaintiff who prevails in a FOIA case, especially where the public body has acted arbitrarily and capriciously in denying the FOIA request. See MCL 15.240(6).

I appreciate your assistance in processing this request in a timely manner as required by law. If you need any clarification or have any questions about this request, please contact me immediately at coriosterman@nowkalamazoo.org.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cori Osterman

title: Transgender Healthcare for ICE Detainees in Contracted Jail Facilities (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Transgender Healthcare for ICE Detainees in Contracted Jail Facilities (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of January 1, 2023, through the date this request is processed, I request records concerning the provision of medical and mental health care to transgender individuals detained in facilities operated by, or under contract with, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).

Specifically, I request:

Policies, procedures, directives, training materials, or guidance regarding gender-affirming medical or mental health care, including hormone therapy continuation or initiation, housing and classification decisions and medical accommodations for transgender detainees.

Communications (including emails, memoranda, letters, meeting notes) between ICE, the Department of Homeland Security, ICE contractors, state agencies or local government entities regarding:

The provision or limitation of gender-affirming care for transgender detainees;

Compliance with state laws restricting public funding or provision of transgender-related medical treatment, including but not limited to Kansas Senate Bill 63 (“Help Not Harm Act”).

Contracts, intergovernmental service agreements (IGSAs), statements of work, task orders or amendments between ICE and any state, county or private detention facility addressing medical care responsibilities, standards of care or exclusions applicable to transgender detainees.

Grievances, complaints, incident reports, investigations or internal reviews relating to alleged denial, delay, modification or termination of gender-affirming medical care for transgender ICE detainees.

Billing records, invoices, reimbursements or denials reflecting whether gender-affirming medical services were approved, denied or excluded from payment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JasmineLewin

For the period of January 1, 2023, through the date this request is processed, I request records concerning the provision of medical and mental health care to transgender individuals detained in facilities operated by, or under contract with, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).

Specifically, I request:

Policies, procedures, directives, training materials, or guidance regarding gender-affirming medical or mental health care, including hormone therapy continuation or initiation, housing and classification decisions and medical accommodations for transgender detainees.

Communications (including emails, memoranda, letters, meeting notes) between ICE, the Department of Homeland Security, ICE contractors, state agencies or local government entities regarding:

The provision or limitation of gender-affirming care for transgender detainees;

Compliance with state laws restricting public funding or provision of transgender-related medical treatment, including but not limited to Kansas Senate Bill 63 (“Help Not Harm Act”).

Contracts, intergovernmental service agreements (IGSAs), statements of work, task orders or amendments between ICE and any state, county or private detention facility addressing medical care responsibilities, standards of care or exclusions applicable to transgender detainees.

Grievances, complaints, incident reports, investigations or internal reviews relating to alleged denial, delay, modification or termination of gender-affirming medical care for transgender ICE detainees.

Billing records, invoices, reimbursements or denials reflecting whether gender-affirming medical services were approved, denied or excluded from payment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JasmineLewin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of January 1, 2023, until whenever this request is fulfilled, I request access to and copies of the following records concerning the provision of medical and mental health care to transgender individuals housed in your facility under contracts or agreements with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Specifically:

1. Policies, procedures, protocols or training materials regarding gender-affirming medical or mental healthcare, hormone therapy continuation or initiation, housing, classification or medical accommodations for transgender detainees.

5. Invoices, billing records, or reimbursement documentation showing whether gender-affirming care was approved, denied, or excluded from payment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Surprise AZ Planning & Zoning, ICE Warehouse
communications.communication:
To the Public Records/FOIA Officer:
Under the Arizona Public Records Act, I am requesting an opportunity to obtain copies of public records relating to the property located at 13290 W Sweetwater Ave, Surprise, AZ 85379.
Specifically, I am requesting the following records created, submitted, or received between January 1, 2025 and the date this request is processed:

- All building permits, renovation permits, variance requests, or "Change of Use" applications filed for the aforementioned property.
- All code compliance inspection reports, certificates of occupancy, and violation notices regarding the property.
- Any site plans, architectural drawings, or engineering evaluations submitted by the property owner, their LLC, or the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) regarding retrofitting the facility.

To expedite this request and reduce the administrative burden on your office, I am requesting these records in their native electronic format (e.g., PDF for documents, .PST or .EML for emails) delivered via email or secure download link.

If any part of this request is denied or redacted, please provide a written response citing the specific statutory exemption being applied.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me beforehand if the estimated cost will exceed $25. However, I also request a waiver of all fees, as the disclosure of this information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of local government operations and infrastructure planning.

Thank you for your prompt assistance and public service.

Sincerely,
Matthew Ruehle
